item.title: Adding REAL pickpocketing to your server. NOW WITH A HANDLER!
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“geel9, post:4, topic:340148”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=436522.msg3207281#msg3207281 date=1273922942]
lolwat, arguments?

p.s. 1) Conventions, 2) Voids = methods
[/quote]

Sorry, I mainly program in other languages.[/quote]

it still wouldnt be called arguments XD the stuff the function(c#)/method(java) receives in the (int/string/ect…) are the arguments. i know c++ and personally prefer java O_O this is a good way to learn the basics (: i just learned a little bit of swing with this so its not too horrible XD

wow… i am bad at getting off topic O_O

Read full topic

item.title: Adding REAL pickpocketing to your server. NOW WITH A HANDLER!
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

Code is a little messy (mainly talking about the arguments). Otherwise it looks pretty good. One question though; When you are calculating the chance of a successful pickpocket. You said a 1 in X chance of getting a success (X of course being your level). Wouldn’t that mean if you get a higher thieving level, the success rate decreases?

Read full topic

Naww you didnt leech but somehow that was posted way before this?

Lol fail leecher is fail, You probably leeched this too:
[/quote]

That looks nothing like my code, what the hell are you on about

item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

That’s a shit load of arguments for method Rob.

P.S: Instead of explaining every line by line, just add conventions to your code. It saves the hassle and makes programmers using your code understand what you are saying.

item.title: Adding REAL pickpocketing to your server. NOW WITH A HANDLER!
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:5, topic:340148”][quote author=spy man47 link=topic=436522.msg3207418#msg3207418 date=1273933286]
Yh, Voids are methods…

But nice…
[/quote]

They’re actually return types of methods - which consists of every data type - including Strings as well. A method without a return type is a constructor and has to have the same name as its class.

@OP: use conventions, don’t use so many method arguments, and clean it up a bit.[/quote]

Its not all so bad but yer your right.

Read full topic

Yh, Voids are methods…

They’re actually return types of methods - which consists of every data type - including Strings as well. A method without a return type is a constructor and has to have the same name as its class.
